Label: Aquifer System
Description: A system of one or more aquifer units that function as a hydrologic system.

Label: Aquifer Unit
Description: A hydrogeologic unit that is capable of storing and transmitting water in economically significant quantities.

Label: Hydrogeologic Unit
Description: A body of rock or sediment distinguished and characterized by its porosity and permeability in relation to groundwater flow.

Label: Water Well
Description: A borehole or excavation drilled into the ground to access groundwater.

Label: groundwater aquifer system
Description: Links a feature to the aquifer system it is associated with.

Label: contains
Description: Indicates that one hydrologic feature contains another.

Label: conforms to
Description: An established standard to which the resource conforms.

Label: format
Description: The file format, media type, or dimensions of the resource.

Label: VoID Dataset
Description: A set of RDF triples that are published, maintained or aggregated by a single provider.

Label: Link Set
Description: A collection of RDF links between two datasets.

Label: Linkset
Description: A collection of RDF links between two datasets.

Label: property
Description: The property used to link resources in a linkset.

Label: target
Description: The target dataset of a linkset.

Label: Entry Point
Description: An entry point for an API or action.

Label: List Item
Description: An item in a list.

Label: News Article
Description: A news article or piece of journalism.

Label: Organization
Description: An organized entity such as a company, government agency, or institution.

Label: Person
Description: An individual human being.

Label: Search Action
Description: An action to perform a search query.

Label: Web Page
Description: A single page on a website.

Label: Web Site
Description: A website or web presence.

Label: as WKT
Description: The WKT (Well-Known Text) serialization of a geometry.

Label: coordinate reference system
Description: The coordinate reference system used by the geometry.

Label: has geometry
Description: Links a feature to its geometric representation.

Label: Geometry Collection
Description: A collection of heterogeneous geometric primitives.

Label: Line String
Description: A one-dimensional geometric primitive consisting of a sequence of points.

Label: Point
Description: A zero-dimensional geometric primitive representing a position in space.

Label: Polygon
Description: A two-dimensional geometric primitive bounded by an exterior boundary and zero or more interior boundaries.

Label: Observation Collection
Description: A collection of observations.

Label: has feature of interest
Description: Links an observation to the feature that was observed.

Label: connected to
Description: Indicates that two hydrologic features are connected.

Label: Feature Catalog
Description: A catalog of feature types and their properties.

Label: Feature Link Set
Description: A set of links between features in different datasets.

Label: Data Download
Description: A dataset in downloadable form.

Label: Geographic Coordinates
Description: Geographic coordinates specifying latitude and longitude.

Label: Geographic Shape
Description: A geographic shape such as a polygon or line.

Label: Organization
Description: An organized entity such as a company, government agency, or institution.

Label: Property Value
Description: A property-value pair for structured data.

Label: about
Description: The subject matter of the content.

Label: content URL
Description: The direct URL to access the content.

Label: description
Description: A textual description of the entity.

Label: distribution
Description: A downloadable form of the dataset.

Label: encoding format
Description: The file format or media type of the resource.

Label: geographic location
Description: The geographic coordinates of the entity.

Label: geo intersects
Description: Indicates that this geographic feature spatially intersects with another.

Label: geo within
Description: Indicates that this geographic feature is spatially contained within another.

Label: identifier
Description: A unique identifier for the entity.

Label: is based on
Description: Indicates a resource from which this resource is derived.

Label: latitude
Description: The latitude of the location.

Label: line
Description: A line string representing a linear geographic feature.

Label: location
Description: The location of the entity.

Label: longitude
Description: The longitude of the location.

Label: measurement method
Description: The method used to perform measurements.

Label: measurement technique
Description: The technique or method used to make measurements.

Label: name
Description: The name of the entity.

Label: polygon
Description: A polygon representing the geographic boundary.

Label: property ID
Description: A commonly used identifier for the property.

Label: provider
Description: The organization or person that provides the resource.

Label: publisher
Description: The organization or person that published the resource.

Label: same as
Description: Indicates that this entity is the same as another entity (used for linking).

Label: subject of
Description: A resource that describes this entity.

Label: superseded by
Description: Indicates that this resource has been replaced by another resource.

Label: temporal coverage
Description: The time period covered by the dataset or content.

Label: unit text
Description: The unit of measurement in text form.

Label: URL
Description: The URL of the resource.

Label: value
Description: The value of a property.

Label: variable measured
Description: The variable that was measured in the dataset.

Label: Catchment (Application Schema)
Description: Application schema implementation of a catchment feature.

Label: Catchment Divide
Description: The boundary that separates adjacent catchments; a drainage divide.

Label: Hydrometric Feature (Application Schema)
Description: Application schema implementation of a hydrometric feature.

Label: Catchment
Description: A physiographic unit with hydrological significance, having defined extent (a catchment boundary) and runoff characteristics. A catchment may be dendritic or non-dendritic.

Label: Catchment Aggregate
Description: An aggregation of multiple catchments treated as a single hydrologic unit.

Label: Dendritic Catchment
Description: A catchment with a tree-like drainage pattern, having a single outflow point.

Label: Flow Path
Description: A linear hydrologic feature representing the path of water flow through a catchment or water body.

Label: Hydrologic Network
Description: A network of connected hydrologic features such as flow paths and nexuses.

Label: Hydrologic Nexus
Description: A hydrologic determination (not a hydrographic feature) representing the place where a hydrologic phenomena occurs; a nexus is a point-location where a flow path is logically joined.

Label: Hydrologic Location
Description: A location on or related to a hydrologic feature, such as a position along a river or within a catchment.

Label: Hydrometric Feature
Description: A hydrologic feature where hydrometric observations or measurements are made, such as a gauging station.

Label: Hydrometric Network
Description: A network of hydrometric features for systematic observation and measurement of hydrologic phenomena.

Label: catchment realization
Description: Links a catchment to its geometric or hydrographic realization.

Label: contributing catchment
Description: Links a catchment to another catchment that contributes flow to it.

Label: encompassing catchment
Description: Links a catchment to a larger catchment that contains it.

Label: exorheic drainage
Description: Indicates that a catchment has drainage to the ocean or sea.

Label: hydrometric network
Description: Links a hydrometric feature to the network it belongs to.

Label: inflow
Description: Links a catchment or water body to a feature from which water flows into it.

Label: lower catchment
Description: Links a catchment to another catchment that is downstream and directly connected to it.

Label: network station
Description: Links a hydrometric network to a hydrometric feature (station) that is part of the network.

Label: nexus realization
Description: Links a hydrologic nexus to its geometric realization.

Label: outflow
Description: Links a catchment or water body to a feature to which water flows out from it.

Label: realized catchment
Description: Links a geometric or hydrographic feature to the catchment it realizes.

Label: realized nexus
Description: Links a geometric feature to the hydrologic nexus it realizes.

Label: receiving catchment
Description: Links a catchment to another catchment that receives flow from it.

Label: upper catchment
Description: Links a catchment to another catchment that is upstream and directly connected to it.

Label: distance description
Description: A description of distance along a hydrologic feature.

Label: distance from referent
Description: The distance from a reference point along a hydrologic feature.

Label: Hydrologic Location (Schema)
Description: Schema definition of a hydrologic location.

Label: hydrologic location type
Description: Specifies the type of hydrologic location (e.g., stream, canal, estuary).

Label: indirect position
Description: A position defined indirectly through a linear referencing system.

Label: containing catchment
Description: Links a feature to the catchment that contains it.

Label: distance description
Description: Provides a textual description of distance along a hydrologic feature.

Label: distance expression
Description: Provides a numerical expression of distance along a hydrologic feature.

Label: interpolative
Description: Indicates whether a position is interpolated along a linear feature.

Label: linear element
Description: Links a hydrologic location to the linear element (flow path) it references.

Label: referenced position
Description: Links a hydrologic location to a position along a linear referencing system.

Label: length
Description: The length of a geographic feature (Wikidata property).

Label: width
Description: The width of a geographic feature (Wikidata property).

Label: mouth of watercourse
Description: The body of water into which the watercourse drains (Wikidata property).

Label: origin of watercourse
Description: The source or origin of a watercourse (Wikidata property).

Label: Atmosphere
Description: Locations in the atmospheric environment, such as precipitation measurement sites.

Label: Canal
Description: An artificial waterway constructed for navigation, drainage, or water conveyance.

Label: Ditch
Description: An artificial channel for drainage or irrigation.

Label: Diversion
Description: A location where water is diverted from its natural course.

Label: Estuary
Description: A partially enclosed coastal water body where freshwater from rivers meets and mixes with saltwater from the ocean.

Label: Ocean
Description: Marine water bodies and oceanic features.

Label: Shore
Description: The land along the edge of a body of water.

Label: Sinkhole
Description: A depression or hole in the ground caused by collapse of the surface layer, often associated with karst topography.

Label: Stream
Description: A natural watercourse flowing on or under the earth surface.

Label: Subsurface
Description: A location below the earth's surface, typically referring to groundwater features.
